SimCity 4 is one of my favorite city building/managment games.  I originally had the SimCity 4 Deluxe Edition on 4 CD's but after fighing with EA to get the software installed and working. I just gave up and bought the game on Steam when there had it for like $7.00. I'm glad that I purchased the game on Steam!!! As long as I have my Steam account I will always play the game.

Update 1/24/2015
Now that I have been playing SimCity 4 Deluxe Edition thru Steam I love the game more so now. I also added the following in Steam for SC4's Set Launch Options: -CustomResolution:enabled -r1600x1200x32 -d:DirectX -CPUPriority:high -CPUCount:1 -intro:off. SC4 been playing with no more crashes. 

If you want to use this setting make sure you change the following:
-r1600x1200x32 -> to match your screen ressolution
-d:DirectX -> SC4 was made for DirectX and NOT OpenGL.
-CPUPriority:high -> use this setting if you have a Dual or Quad CPU (ADM or INTEL) (remember this game is from 2003)
-CPUCount:1 -> use this setting if you have a Dual or Quad CPU (ADM or INTEL)(remember this game is from 2003)
An amazing game. I've played it for many hours and I end up actually prefering it to the new SimCity that came out a while ago. A must have for SimCity fans.

One of the best (if not the best) city managment simulations out there. It has it's flaws, and the graphics is old-age but the hundreds of hours of fun are well worth it.
If you plan on playing it on Windows 7, 16:9 screen and a multicore, add this to the launcher's options (right click on the SimCity4 voice in Steam/properties/set launch options):
-d:Software -CustomResolution:enabled -r1366x768x32 -f -intro:off -CPUCount:1 -AllowMultipleInstances
This games suck because I have no idea how to keep up but after many tried and I beat it with easy level.  Great game after all but take way too much of my time :)

This game is Mr. Turtle approved.

A classic city builder, indepth but not boring or hard to grasp in the least.
You have disasters which you can control, the game 
only generates fires as its natural disasters leaving it all up to you to level the city.

You have three zones Residential, Commercial, and Industrial. 
There is argriculture but that's just another industrial zone.
So you can make a little farming community if you wish. 
Or a bustling metropolis.

You manage water, electricity, and trash.
You may trade with a neighbor in the region.
However all the cities in the region are built by you.
You can generate simple regions and edit the terrain via each section of the entire map. 
So click a tile, load in, mess with the terrain if you please and then you get down to business and enter Mayor mode.
Gone are your god-like powers... sure.... 

It's a fun game and a must have for those who like to build cities.
I've played almost every sim game in the Maxis catalog with the exception of The Sims. SimCity 2000 is still my #1 city building sim but SimCity 4 is easily second.

Once you've figured out how to make viable cities, this game gets boring. But it's fun up until that point. No real way to create your own regions any more - in theory it's possible, but it's tedious and error prone and all the region archives are gone for the most part.
Enjoyable and worthwhile. The realism is nice and the nostalgia this game brings makes playing it even more rewarding. Great classic that is still kicking strong even with the new version out.

This is game so much fun, has a good measure of complexity to it, though it can feel somewhat repetative after 100 hours of playing it. Go figure : P

Other reviews cover the game quite well, but be prepared to never be able to establish an effective mass transit system, its like your citizens will do anything to avoid taking the subway or even the highway. So sometimes trying to solve traffic problem can be futile.

This is the definitive SimCity game! If you do not know, in SimCity 4, you build a city, while trying your best to not go into debt and lose! But this game is so much better than SimCity 2013! Because, no online DRM, this is cheaper than SC2013, and it is very moddable! Get this - not SC2013!

SimCity 4 is a game that I spent a lot of time with in my early 20s. It had its fair share of bugs when it was first released and I remember a lot of frustration on forums early on. Crashes were frequent and the performance was not great despite having hardware more than capable of handling it. These many years later, the game runs much more smoothly than it ever did and it's a joy to go back and play. It's complex without being irritating (I will never understand where to put bus stations to get them to work properly, though). I've played SimCity since the first game was released in the late 80s (I played it in the early 90s), and SC4 ranks high on my list - perhaps below SC2000, but slightly higher than SC3000. The beauty of SC4 is the size of the maps, the inclusion of regions and the varied building style. The customisation of terrain is also the most advanced of all of the SimCities (in the latest one, terrain editing is sadly lacking). The latest SimCity is not worthy of the name and this represents the last of the good ones.

Sim City is a great franchise and Sim City 4 is a great game. I own Sim City 4 on pc for steam, Origin, and physical copy, so I obviously like the game. SM4 runs well and looks great even today, for being an isometric game that says alot. Sim City isnt the easiest game nor is it the most straight forward but that doesnt mean not fun. SC4 IS FUN and even though im not amazing at it I still recomend it 9/10. I look forward to playing more on steam and hope you find this helpul. P.S. if your pacient you might be lucky and get this on one of it's 75% off sales like me. Have fun. :)
-effencrazy

I've played this game since the 2000 version. Still, I find the previous versions is better than this one. Maybe because in this series the cities are devided inside huge region, so I find it pretty boring to play.
For me, I prefer one huge or giant map to build a single city than having a huge region and build several cities over and over.
Boring, but it's okay since I'm a collector of SimCity series.

I was excited about SimCity 2013. I forgot it is a game from EA who has a bad reputation for very unfinished games. Just 6 hours in, I quit and went back to SimCity 4. SimCity 4 doesn't require constant internet connection to play, has way more buildings to grow and place, has better pathfinding traffic, has a fast-forward button THAT ACTUALLY FAST-FORWARDS, allows manual density zoning, the smallest city size in SC4 is 4 times larger than in SimCity, aaaaaaaand it's moddable. Yes, the lack of the GlassBox effects and agents are a bit of a downer, but you can get a city in SC4 to look just as great with the mods from team Pegasus.

The best SimCity game that you can purchase through Steam currently.  Hit up the community page for tips on increasing the resolution and then go to town (haha).

7/10  Would purchase again

What a great game for such a famous franchise SimCity 4 is a famous gaming phenomenon. First off there is infinte things to do such as making a robot destroy a city and starting new, or making a new region and designing it and making it your own. Secondly the mod community is absolutly huge including: buldings, cheats, better ordinances, or fences on backyards it's quite a good thing to get into. Additionally the game is rather complex it's challenging to learn if u dont know much about a budget but it deosnt beat u to death just don't spend to much to fast. In all honesty i have never found any bugs on the game that i have thought to be game breaking, but it does crash from time to time on new sytems like windows 7.

SimCity™ 4 Deluxe Edition offers the whole SimCity™ 4 experience, and in my opinion is the best SimCity™ game yet. It also allows you to export some of your creations and import them into The Sims™ 2, so if you also have that one installed you're in for a treat.

I checked out a lot of forums saying this is one of the best god-games/ city builders out there and I had played a different SimCity years ago and had a lot of fun. IMO this game wouldn't make my top 10. I got this game for 5$ so in that regard, yes I recommend rolling the dice.

At a healthy eleven years old SimCity 4 may very well be the last great Maxis game. The replayability of this game is huge, trying to develop different cities against new challenges or even planning entire regions (which can take dozens, even hundreds of hours). Then, when all is said and done, knock out a few hours in sandbox mode by displaying your almighty wrath with earthquakes, fires, alien invasions, and giant robot attacks. Unlike its decendent, SimCity, this game does not have an always-online component (nor does it have any online play) and is a complete package game.
Even after so many years, this game still works. Not just in the technical - and optical - sense, it's still entertaining and challenging, and all around a lot of fun!

So far, it is incredibly (sim)ilar to previous entries in the series, but with more modern graphics. Unfortunately, many of the utilities feature graphical oddities that hinder the experience.
All things considered, I think this is the best SimCity since SimCity 2000, and will remain that way until EA gets its shit together

Quite possibly the best simulation / building game available. It is rich with detail, decent graphics even for today, and provides a wonderful sandbox environment. The cities are quite large, unlike Sim City 5 - and the incredible amount of options and detail will keep you entertained for hours. Definitely worth the investment.

SimCity 4, the last Maxis SimCity, remains the best of its genre to this day. Although it lacks the speculative technology of SimCity 2000 or the beautiful slit-scan rendering of the (perhaps unfairly infamous) 2013 revision, SC4 is thorough and rigorous in its realism and level of simulated detail. 
For example, to check the operation of the simulation at the individual level, you can create and follow sims (and their dynasties) as they travel around from home to work and back, finding jobs appropriate to their social class/level of education, to test your city's transportation grid down to the individual level of detail.
This Deluxe Edition comes with the Rush Hour expansion which adds even more detail and control options to transportation simulation. The only significant drawback is that, like previous SimCities, roads cannot truly bend or angle properly; cities consequently must be laid out more or less in a grid pattern. Of course, as Atlanta just demonstrated in Half-Inchopocalypse 2014, there are excellent reasons to avoid curving and angling roads all over the place in city planning, so this is a feature that you most likely won't miss.

SimCity 4 is a fun game.  If you played simcity2000 this is the perfect successor to that game.  Pipes are simplified, water is easy and plentiful.  Power is generally easy to manage as are most the cities systems.  I didn't HAVE to cheat to win this game or even to play it the way I wanted to.  The cities seem to adapt better no matter how poorly you place zones.  
I love this game.

However....  Numerous crash issues, memory leak issues, Huge cities seem to bog down the game in ways you wouldn't expect.  (water being there then not there then there in pipes, leading to rallies about not having water then they do) My pc is far an away powerful enough to run this game, a beast machine when this game was made new. Still this game does not always work.  I would say this game is worth playing, toying around with despite it's many bad programming faults. Just be aware and save often.
I have no idea what I'm doing. My advisors told me I was doing everything wrong with my city so I wiped everyone out with an asteroid. 10/10 would play.

You can create entire continents of cities and link them together, having them depend on each other and work together.  The simulation itself is great, and you often have to balance a few different things just to turn a profit.  Easily the best SimCity so far, especially when compared to SimCity (2013), which was awful.  I love this game, and so should you.

This is an amazing game that really needs a kickstarted modern clone or the like to bring it into the modern age.  But SC4DE is still worth playing if you can get the necessary mods together and functional.

This is the last Good Sim City game. 

You start with a Region, in the real world. 
You make a town in that region. 
You than make another town in that region. 
Both towns can now make deals with each other to sutain one another. 

That, is how close you can be as a State Governer if you manage to occupy every city territory in the entire region. 

There is also some early The Sims to the short lived social massivly multiplayer game Sims Online. Yeah, so if you had the origanal The Sims, you can import that charater to be an individual Blessed by the god, known as Mayor in your city. A rather unused feature. 

The only problem is people in this game don't like to use public transit, even if you forced them. Commercal zones don't quite develope or have enough demand and job creation. Also everything has to be severly under budget to stay in the green, even if the Sims go to school, they don't really go to school to justify 200 student capacity and 15 teachers when only 17 attend. It would just be cheaper with no schools and emergancy services even if the advisers piss and moan. All problems non-existant in Sim City 3000.

If you like these kind of games (strategy, economy, building the entire city, even the transports), you are late, GET THIS GAME NOW!!!
IT'S FUCKING AWESOME. 
-Hundreds of hours of play!
-It can even run on a netbook (you can hack the resolution, google it), and it doesn't lag!
-Good replayability!
-The graphics aged really well, i think they still look pretty much perfect, they don't have to be better. (i don't care about graphics in fact, but in this case, even if i cared, it aged well!)
-Thousands of mods and buildings that you can download, so these can make your games longer, better and more replayable!
-The possibilities are huge, you could make a city in the desert, in the mountains, whatever biome, and if you don't like it, you can modify the land in any way you want.
-The driving missions are sometimes hard, but it's awesome to drive in your own city, the roads you made. And it also reflects the traffic load in your city.
-The transports! There's almost anything: planes, trains, ferry, and more. And each one has its missions, and loads of vehicles.
So yeah, i'm forgetting stuff. I love this game, i played it even more on my pirated version, but i finally bought it, it is totally worth it, and you can trust a stranger for once ;)
Good game, I still prefer this over the new SimCity. Because there aren't as many bugs and the graphics are(generally) easy to run on your computer. It doesn't take up much space either. 7/10

This game is epic nosalga for me. I do love watching my little guys go about their business not knowing what I have in store for them in the future. Ah little sim people, if only I could warn you the power station as a risk to your health and I dont have the moeny to repace it. :(

Classic Sim City still going strong. Do yourself a favor and go download as many mods as you can for this game. The Netwark Addon Mod (NAM) is a must have mod. Check out youtube for some really awesome building a city from scratch videos.

Simcity 4 Deluxe Edition is probably the best city builder out there. It's graphic design is timeless and soundtrack offers some best elevator music available. One of the perks of this simulation is the ability to run a whole region, not just one city, and to terraform it to your liking. One of the cons of it is the square-grid, that limits the organic look of your city, but at the same time, the city feels alive thanks to advisors, newsreels with puns, missions you can perform driving around various vehicles in the game and even ability to plant your own sims in there (that you can also import from your original Sims game, should you own one). The basic square-based layout also makes the game somewhat easier and less time consuming.

There are some SERIOUS ISSUES, that can hurt your gameplay, like crashes or jagged graphics, but these CAN BE FIXED easily when you find the right community guides. It takes just changing few lines to make the game run smooth and detailed on modern machines. 

Also, the game has many mods available, but they are not essential in my opinion.

If you like management games, or the idea of growing a community, then this game is for you. There's a lot to plan, I realized that it was incredibly useful to do this far after I needed to. It's incredibly addicting and fun, and has tons and tons of content. Approximately 87.43 times better than SimCity 5.

After being really dissapointed by Simcity 5, jumping back into SC4 felt like a relief. The mechanics are just perfect and everything works in a harmony never seen before in any management game. It's cheap and worth your while, especially when you are a younger player and never had anything to do with simcity in the past.

Must have!

I got a bug for this series since playing Sim City on the SNES way back. Then again, maybe it wasn't a bug as I never played any of the games apart from the SNES version and this, but I trusted the general angle of the reviews.

In short, a great game that's ages superbly. You can really soak up the hours once you get a city going and you have massive control. The 'tutorial' cities give you breathing room and you're bound to learn from your mistakes quickly when you get caught in the traps of over/under development of certain of your cities' aspects.

I'm quite rubbish at the game, but that doesn't stop it being one of the most absorbing games I've ever played (in that sense, I'd put it there with the likes of Morrowind, Zelda, FFVII, Shenmue - games that utterly took hold of me!)

After ten years, this game has a much better quality and exceed way over the limitation found in Simcity 2013. Pack this game with mods from the community which is still active, even after ten years, and surely your playing one of the best and classic City-simulation game ever.  Sure graphics is dated, but you'll find much more gameplay and replay value in this game compare to Simcity 2013.

Fantastic city building game, with a great modding community that vastly expands on the already fun features of the original game.

Edit 2020-08-08: I would now recommend more modern offerings, in particular Cities: Skylines over this title, unless steeply discounted. In my opinion this game broke new ground in the depth offered by city builders, but I feel other titles have taken the principles developed with this release further.

Balancing a budget is the hardest part of this game, but once you get the hang of it, and explore what this game has to offer, this is a great game. I go through phases where all i want to play is games like this, and when it comes around, this is the one i turn to first.

I'm not as familiar as some might be with the Sim City series. The last one I played was on the SNES and compared to SC4 it definitely has it's differences. Even after 18 years of not playing, it was easy to get back into Sim City after playing through the tutorials. Being able to setup a region and build cities in different sections all across it is cool. Also liked that I can add mountains, valleys, rivers, lakes etc.. and customize the regions to my liking. The Rush hour expansion is a nice addition so I can control what kind of transportation I want in my cities and provides an extra challenge to building my cities. I've only put in a couple of sessions and I know there are so many features in this game I haven't touched on.

I would tell anyone who is looking for a strategy/simulation game then this one should be considered. I was very iffy about the newest Sim City which is why I picked this one up. You don't have to worry about being online to play the game and works well with current operating systems. If you are interested in getting a start into Sim City games then I would say start here.

Brings back gaming memories from years ago! Still can't seem to figure out how to properly grow a city though. 
Wish the graphics were updated to at least utilize my full screen, but I'd still recommend it if you catch it on sale like I did.
Fun, immersive game. Takes me back to when I spent hours playing the original Sim City. It's still the same fun game at the core, with increased playability and more challenges.

Just got this on sale for $3

Brings back memories when I first bought this a decade ago. I can see me wasting many hours again on this game. Well worth it IMO.

Classic. This game is highly underrated and is one of the best strategy games in existance. Doesn't knock 3000 off of the throne but it's still very nicely done. The addition of roads in zones and the ability to import maps into Sims 2 for playing on there is great. All in all, if you enjoy strategy games, like Zoo tycoon or Roller coaster tycoon, this game will be right up your street.

I am majorly a FPS and RPG fan. But this is one game I have spent playing hours. I played the game a friends place and bought it soon. Replay ability is great and never ends. You can waste months playing this (unlike typical 12-16 hours game) and it will still entertain you.

It does teaches you some lessons in finance too ;).

SimCity as it was meant to be. Beautiful and well done, this game will delight any SimCity fan. However, finances are ludicrously impossible, and the game is merely a perfection of the previous games. There really isn'y anything new but it's stable and you don't need to be always online like the new disasterously launched version.

SimCity 4 is an amazing game where you build manage (and destroy if you want) a city that you build from the ground up. it has an excellent user interface that is easy to navigate and understand. you can build numerous cities with different sizes and landscapes. Every part of your city is in your hands. it grows from demand of its citizens. You are the mayor and You decide if your city will become a megalopolis

I quite like this game, much better than the current installment. The game is fun to play and will have you enthralled for hours watching your citys grow. I have sure watched my custom little sims run about and live out there lives, I feel bad now since I destroyed my city by meteorite.

I made 3 cities connected to each other.  One was an industrial hellhole filled with pollution and projects I aptly named dystopia.    
Eventually I built Area 5.1 there and constantly shot at protesters with my tanks.  I made an adjacent city called Libertopia, the irony being most of it's industrial needs were being met by Dystopia.  Bordering the 2 was a city focused on science, that would probably provide both with their technological needs, be it internet vpns or new weapons technology to oppress the Project residents of Dystopia.  Bretty gud game 5/5 (you can't do that in the newest Sim City)

This game has great staying power and still retains its charm.  Yes the graphics are old, but the available mods (including curved road) keep the game fun.  I was so glad to discover it on Steam as it didn't work correctly when installing from the original CDs.  Discover (or rediscover) the game, and start searching the many, many SC4 mod sites.  Pure love.
Great fun, really enjoyed being able to link cities together. The mini-missions are fun, and the maps/regions are impressive. You can spend days playing this game and not get sick of it.

A decade old and still an absolutely fantastic game that doesn't look or feel even slightly dated. 

If this was released today, it would be praised for its attention to detail and vast simulation improvements over the new Simcity (2013). Basically, this game is 1/4 of the price of the newest release, and CONSIDERABLY better.

Simulation is in-depth and chock full of charts, graphs, and data overlays. Build whole, huge regions of billions of sims, with cities all interconnected to form vast metropolises. Plot sizes are up to 16x larger than the newest Simcity (2013) and they directly border their neighbours, allowing you to build a large city over the course of several plots. Not only that, but when linked they can share demand and resources very easily.

In short - buy this.
I played this game a lot when i was 16 or whatever... but I played it recently and it's still a hell of a lot of fun and even after 10 years is better then SimCity 2013...
The best game ever. Mess with people's lives, make a HUGE city, do what you want,build it how you want it. Not much else I can say other then GET IT!

Good classic game. Great to pick up and play and, if you have a sims game it will interact to allow you to import your family to the city. There are some down sides, i.e. some random crashes (save often), can get a little dull after a while and it is quite easy. This however does not detract from the fact that this is a great game.
An enjoyable stress free game. Feels very much like an upgraded version of the trusty old simcity 2000 (which remains my favorite and incidently is on sale at gog for $3 at the moment)

This is by far one of the best City simulation games you could play, its fool of features and you can pretty much do anything you want with youre city to You could destroy it if you want to. But the sad part is that the new simcity never lived up to this games greatness. If you have the choice between getting the new Simcity and this ,Get Simcity 4

A good game, but for me Sim City 2000 was the best game, like the bigger map. Would like to be able to switch off disasters, since some of them are silly and for them who just wants to relax and build a nice city, it is boring when a monster comes and ruin the city.

I must have bought this game at least 3 times over the years, having worn out old disc copies before picking it up here on Steam.

Pretty much everything that is wrong with the new SimCity was right in SimCity 4, which was the culmination of over a decade of evolution through the original SimCity, SimCity 2000 and SimCity 3000. A decade further on, there is still a strong community around the game, and plenty of mods available to change everything from the appearance of water to the way the entire highway system works.

If you want to build a sprawling metropolis or a rural country region, this is certainly the game to go with. Only Cities Skylines has come close since.

The epitome of all simulation games, even a decade later and plenty of attempts to match it (Cities XL, Simcity 2013), it still remains king. I've regularly played this game since it first came out. That's how good it is.

This is an oldie but a goodie! If you don't like the idea of tiny build areas, server dependency and not have the ability to save your games before disaster commences then this is for you. Once you get it working with Windows Vista/7 and onwards its a great game with greater depth than its latest incarnation.

A challenging and addicting game.  The gameplay is fairly repetetive, as the sole purpose of the game is to develop a city from the administrative point of view, but the multiple aspects of maintaining a good reputation and the office of mayor do not make the game a cakewalk.  7/10

This game is 17 years old, but is still an amazing and addictive simulator.  In addition to the 510 hours on record, there's at least 200 more that I had on the retail version I bought back in '03.

But to keep it up to modern-ish standards, download some essential mods from Simtropolis: NAM, CAM, SC4 Datanode, Propfix, Road Top Mass Transit, and Crime Doesn't Pay.  To list a few.

This game sure is fun for hours and hours if you love planning and managing so I do recommend - but if you've played any of the epic older Sim City games you might get frustrated with this one since at least in my opinion the game developement seems to have gone backwards meaning the older games remain better even this is newer.

Bei dem doch sehr verunglückten Sim City 5 (2013) greift man doch lieber zum Vorgänger aus dem letzten Jahrzehnt. Der Grafik merkt man dies vielleicht an, jedoch nicht dem Spielspaß und dem bewährten Konzept einer Städtesimulation!

Easier than the new Sim City and many possibilities to create a great city. Still quite difficult and I have never had a city with a larger population then 250k and I've never been able to create the tall and great skyscrapers. 8/10

Do you like city building games? Then this is a must-buy for you. Yes, it's almost 10 years old and yeah, it still has stability issues (just remember to save often). But it still is the best city simulation you game you can buy. EA is supposed to release a new one soon, titled SimCity (for some reason they have a thing for this naming convention, eg. Hot Pursuit (2010), Most Wanted (2012)), but I doubt it will live up to the greatness of this game.

A decent SimCity game but very hard to master and effectively support your city without going bankrupt eventually. But if you can master this you can destroy everything and rebuild it from scratch. I'll always have a reason to play it once in a while. But it isn't better than the one that came out most recently.

A very deep simulation game based on real world principles. There's a strategy guide on GameFAQs written by an absurdly well-educated guy. The insight and educational value of these two combined is absolutely ridiculous for the world of gaming.

A very challenging game. It took me exactly 40 hours just to understand everything in this game. It's also super fun. Seeing your city gets bigger bigger is awesome making you that you have reached this point without failing the people.

It's an old game, yet it's still the best city simulator ever released. BUY IT!

Edit: This review was written long before Cities: Skylines was released. If you're looking for a more modern (and 3D) experience, go with C:S. I enjoy both and I have no intention of quitting SimCity 4.

Out of the box, I'd really can't recommend SC4 Deluxe to anyone but veterans of the days when you could buy this in a store on a CD, mainly due to compatibility issues, unresolved issues in the simulation, and frequent crashes. As much as I have loved this game, it honestly doesn't hold up by itself in 2020. 

SimCity 4's saving grace is its robust, extensive, long lived mod scene. The Network Addon Mod, or NAM, is pretty much considered an essential addition to any player's collection, and thus is the best one to start with. Heap on some custom buildings and perhaps a few other mods like the Colossus Addon Mod, and SC4 itself becomes essential. 

I highly recommend Cities: Skylines as well, both to SC4 vets and new players alike. Skylines in some ways is what SimCity 5 (2013) should have been. It's amazing to note that much of what Paradox has done was inspired by good ol' SC4 Deluxe!

In summary, don't buy SC4 Deluxe for the out of the box experience. Buy it for the mods that make it an unforgettable, perhaps even life-changing experience.

One final note: Don't buy this from Origin, even if it happens to be cheaper. The Origin version is not up-to-date and does not support newer mods, like the NAM. Buy from Steam or GOG.

WARNING: Will likely cause depression upon realising you just doomed an entire city.

On the other hand, hilariously addictive and mind numbingly frustrating when things go wrong, would recommend to anyone with low blood pressure,

Great this is on is on Steam and is quite cheap for the whole game, and $4:99 on Sale is very Nice! Loads of fun building and fun gameplay and epic Sim City fun, even  when 10 years old, still worth the play and money, 9/10 I will give it!

This game is still a lot of fun and I have never shunned it for any new games like it. Its basicly a city building game but with events, and yes the famous U-Drive it mission make this game alot of gfun.

But the only thing I HATE is the lack of workshop support since there are so many addons and installing them is not always a picnic. Its not complex because even when I was eight I still had a blast although the whole tax thing as a kid made no damn sence. but aside from all that the bottom line here is buy the game unless you do not like city stuff but I loved the hell out this and still am now!

Buy!

i bought this to run it on an older computer. Save yourself the money it runs like crap and has poor gameplay value. More of a reminiscient purchase than anything and wasnt worth whatever i paid for it. They need to reimplemeint sim tower or something just with more depth that doesnt involve stupid traffic management

SimCity 4 is a game that has managed to outlive its limitations. Although it looks the part, its scope and depth both allow it to truly live up to the SimCity franchise. In particular the Region feature- with multiple cities interacting with each other- along with an extensive and active modding scene both help make the game endlessly enjoyable.
I’ve always been a huge fan of the SimCity series. I do feel like this version is the finished product, as complete as it can get. I’m looking forward to the new SimCity in 20013!

Fine as a bargain game to idle away a few hours, but Sim City just isnt the same as it was back in the days. Sure you can do a heck of a lot more now but it becomes boring so quickly (unless you are really keen on figuring out how all these options affect your city).

i started my city, called it Mickville. The city quickly rose above any other before. the evolution of the city was insane. the citizens wealthy, healthy and all with jobs and the scurge which would promote crime was all but wiped out. for years the city worked in good sucession, the city grew bigger and bigger. the community with it.
but... school and health funding was expensive. costs of these things meant that the reserve of money slowly diminished. Jobs were lost and a new breed of crime had begun, the crime started to take over more and more of the city day by day. the police force made a hasty effort to stop the crive wave which was submerging the city, drugs became a big part of the economy, it was the only way for people to make and money, and for some the only way to survive. the crime was that bad that parts of the city least effects were sanctioned off to the rest. this was the last hope for the life of the city. but... this was no end, for what was to come..... the city wouldnt be prepared...... the buildings fall everywere as roiting and violence swept the city. countless adults and even children were majorly injurded and murderd by the crime uprising throughout the city. as the citys police forces efforts were no use.... it was to late for the city..... it all ended with the push of a putton... the bomb dropped killing more and more of the inocent.... killing those which turned agaisnt there city.... there home...... all which has been done was done at a required cost...... 

Those lost will be rememberd

Way better than SimCity 2013:

- It DOES work off-line!
- Customizable regions, up to 32 cities!
- Choice of small, medium and large cities, giving you lots of space to expand your cities!
- Fully single player game, no trolling firends can help you!
- Full modding support with vast community!
- Your sims tend to live and work most of the time in the same place, like real life!
- Lots of mass transport options, incliding buses, trains, elevated trains, monorail, ferries, airports and even a subway system!
- You can drive around your city in one of many availiable vehicles, like cars, buses, trucks, sailing boats and helicopters!
- You decide how the cities are connected: road, rail, highway? You're the boss!

All that and more for a fractions of the price, Origin-free, only on Steam.

How that works for ya?

If you like to spend hours building up metropolises and becoming #1 mayor, then switching to your alter-ego of a rampaging God smiting Sims with attacking robots, UFOs and natural disasters, then this game is for you. :]

Vous incarnez un nouveau maire. Mais seriez-vous LE maire?

La premiere chose a vous faire partager et le manque de détails au niveau textures. Les personnages vous sonnant des conseilssont en pixels mais pour un jeu 2001, on peut faire pire.

Rentrons dans la jouabilité. Une fois un bon début, vous arriverais plus facilement. Effectivement, le jeu est assez dure pour reussir. Une faute peut être difficilement réparable, surtout au début du jeu. Si vous savez manier une ville, se jeu est fait pour vous. Si vous n'arreter pas d'avoir des plaintes, vous risquer de vite laisser ce jeu. 

La durée de vie dépent de votre éxpérience. Si vous commencez bien, vous en avez pour des heures et des heures de plaisir. Or si vous ne savez pas controlé une ville, vous risquez de l'anéantir dès la 3eme plainte.

En conclusion, tout est une question d'éxpérience. Savez-vous creer une ville sans problemes? Allez-vous construire un monde naturel ou indutriel? Avez-vous la capaciter d'être LE maire? Ceci est votre choix.

A classic, and one of my all-time favourite games that even today, I occasionally revisit. Creating a working city is something I've alawys enjoyed, and in the most straightforward of ways, this old game delivers and has stood the test of time with it's fundamental attention to detail, whilst still maintaining it's clean, common-sense UI.   I've chosen to continue playing this over EA's newest incarnation, because this game works - on every level - it just works.

Have easily logged thousands of hours in this over the years and I consider it the definitive city-building title. 

Sidenote: Found it to be slightly buggy in Win 7/64 bit, but so far it's played smoothly in Win 8.1/64.

Edit March 2015:  While this might be the original, it really isn't optimized for newer OS and topping it off, Cities:Skylines has made it what it should have been today. I recommend the latter if you're seeking out a successor to the original series.
I like it :) finally I have played a Sim City game. Tutorials are very good, wasn't even paying attention but they weren't boring and were quick and well sectioned.

The best city building game so far,with fantastic graphics and endless possibilities! Its not a game for everyone,its pretty challenging,but once you figure out how to make money,and you see your city grow,its a fantastic feeling! For mere 5 euros you can become a mayor of your dream city! 
And with the Rush Hour expansion,you can fly planes and helicopters over your city,you can roam the streets in a car,tank,or even an icecream van-yes, an ICE CREAM VAN! A must buy for every fan of strategy games.

City-building with no DRM or always online requirement! You can even download all necessary files for this game from Steam, and then take it offline to play wherever. What more could you wish for...

SC4 has encouraged me to resign my more malevolent personality traits to a giant, sprawling metropolis in digital Simtopia. It has allowed me to remain calm and composed in situations that require it, and my attitude on other world-building sandbox games (like Minecraft) has improved because I take my fire-fisted griefer heart over to my Sims, instead.

Would I recommend SimCity 4 Deluxe Edition? Do bears like honey? Duh.

A Great City Building game.

This doesn't have as much freedom as Cities XL 2011, But it doesn't lag as much at all, And is more of a challange to me. The graphics may not be as fancy, but i prefere older games like this to the newer ones.

If your a person who likes strategy games, Then you should atleast try this out.

Fantastic city builder with tons of depth and penty of mods to keep it fresh and to eliminate any bugs. Great fun even though it's 8 years old and I had no compatibility issues with it on W7 64 bit. The expansion provided also includes side missions that help keep gameplay from becoming stake and help unlock new buildings to use in your city such as an advanced hospital.

Be the mayor of your own city!
Sim City 4 offers many things to build and create your very own city, especially with the Add-On Rush Hour. Connect your city with other cities in your region, trade and let your city grow to a metropole. Of course, it takes time to get all the nice things but it's a nice challenge, with pleasant graphics, relaxing music and some little tasks to improve your reputation.
If you like simulations and wish create the city of your dreams, without going to war, Sim City 4 is a classic.

My favourite SimCity game of them all (and they are all so good), simply because of its depth. Plan city sized commercial districts to feed residential and industrial sectors respectively, or build small villages across a region area that you (with a lot of donkey work, it must be said) can design yourself.

As in some other SimCities, you'll plan neighbourhoods, fund services, enact policies and balance a budget to build a working city.

The last, greatest SimCity game in Maxis' flagship franchise! I already own the original CD release of SC4 Deluxe, and after all these years the game is still fun and refreshing with all the mods one can find on the net. However, being so long since its release, the game has issues with Windows Vista/7. No matter what I tried the game would crash at some point, so when Steam had it for sale this summer (2012) I knew it was worth the $5. Now I finally have a truly compatible version of my favorite SimCity game and I was easily able to copy/paste the mods and saves I've had over the years. Although the CitiesXL series is pretty rad, nothing beats the classics. After all, there's no school like the old school.

Okay, here's the thing; I shouldn't have to recommend this game at all, but I'm going to, just so I can say I did my part. THIS is THE BEST city builder ever made in the history of EVER. If you love micro-managing stuff, I mean really getting your hands dirty down to every last little penny pinching detail, you'd be doing yourself a disservice by not purchasing this game. Even if you never played classic, 2k, 3k, 3k:U, you can still pick this up and learn from scratch and totally understand what all the fuss is about. This game was made back when EA took titles and essentially made them bigger and better and SC4 is definitely the pinnacle of the SimCity franchise. There are no objectives. This is sandbox gameplay in its most pure form. The mod support and mod community is the best I've seen compared to any other modifiable game, even Minecraft. The community at Simtropolis.com in particular, keeps this 10 year old game fresh and endlessly re-playable.

Just what the doctor ordered. I was very bored for about three or four days before I broke down and decided to buy a new game. Having played Sim City 2000 before, I found this game to be very easy to play and even excel at. You can build a city in almost no time.

I spent many an hour building cities when this first came out. I downloaded here on Steam to add it to my collection to play with while waiting on the new SimCity title due out in 2013. The game is complicated to start out with, but the tutorials are very helpful. At the early stages it is fairly simple, but as your city grows, so are their problems.

Amazing game: THE city builder game of all time. Don't bother waiting for the upcoming SC5 since that will be a dumb shitty always online game with few of the qualities that makes SC4 amazing.

Why have you not bought it yet?!

Still a very fun game despite its age. It has much more depth than newer city builders like Cities XL or Simcity Societies/Simcity 2013, the region mode allows you to make very large cities (and the largest city tiles are themselves pretty big), and there is about a decades worth of custom content available on the LEX & STEX.

I don't know about you, but I've been hearing that the mayor rocks according to city blocks.

But in all seriousness, this game is a classic and for good reason. The city simulation that runs behind the scenes, while a bit outdated in its ideas for what good urban planning actually looks like, has yet to be matched by any successor. The region mode allows you to network individual city tiles together to form one large megaopolis, and RCI demand and transportation networks seamlessly carry over into your neighboring cities when establishing connections. It's a great idea, and really lets you build massive cities.

Biggest drawback to playing Simcity 4 nowadays is that it's notoriously difficult to get it running smoothly. As of right now, you're mostly limited to 1080p. Any higher and you'll experience bizarre graphical glitches every now and then but it's still playable overall. Modding is essential to get the full experience, but that's ok because the modding community is one of the best out there, rivaling the likes of Mount and Blade and Rimworld. Haven't tested this game on Windows 11, but can report that it's worked just fine for me on both Windows 7 and Windows 10.

If you havent played a SimCity game by now you probably never will.  I do enjoy them.  They are games that aren't just for people who play video games.  Its interesting to watch your city, you designed, grow.  The only difference in the sequels is mainly the details.  You get more land and has more detailed graphics.  This one lets you connect citys on a much larger map.  I think it even lets you connect to other peoples cities.  I like these games but i dont think this is worth more than 10 bucks.  I never pay much for my games.
Great game to spend many an hour. Play God and Mayor, making your tiny minions bask in your benevolence, or suffer your wrath!  All in the name of urban planning.

Sure beats the hell out of SimCity 2000. It provides a easy to understand balance between different development zones and other factors like pollution, quality of life, healthcare, education access etc. Just an all around fun city simulator that is unfortunately quite graphically dated. Overall if that is your sort of thing it is worth a look.

Nothing like build a multimillion person metropolis and the gettoizing it ah la Detroit.  Too bad is it rather buggy on 64-bit systems otherwise I'd never leave my cities alone.  I've played dozens of city builders, but none are as good as this decade old unforgiving masterpiece.

Note: Skip Sim City 5 and stay with this if you like to create spawl.  If you can't get this to work try Cites XL, which is a decent single city builder.

After all this time this is still my favorite city builder. Great game you can spend hours on and not even know it. The economics are terrible but taxing the sh*t out of people to fund dying cities is very realistic in our lives these days. The one bad thing about this is the lack of arcologies.


Update: Nov. 23, 2017. I played a few minutes of this and still enjoy the random way to build cities on this aging game. Still fun!

On Exactitude in Sim City, ... In that game, the art of mapping attained such perfection that the map of a single city occupied the entirety of a zone, and the map of the region, the entirety of a city. In time, those unconscionable maps no longer satisfied, and the modding community struck a map of a region whose size was that of the region, and which coincided point for point with it. The following gaming generation, who were not so fond of the study of mapping as their forebears had been, saw that that vast map was useless, and not without some pitilessness was it, that they delivered it up to the inclemencies of incompatible versions. In the abandoned websites, still today, there are corrupted files of that map, inhabited by broken links and bugs; in all the Internet there is no other relic of the disciplines of geography. - Suárez Miranda, Viajes de jugadores prudentes, Libro IV,Cap. XLV, Lerida, 1658. (Apologies to Jorge Luis Borges)

Very nostalgic! I remember playing Sim City 2000 back in the day and how much fun it was. This is no different. I was a bit rusty when I started out and went bankrupt several times designing a couple of cities but after awhile things changed (hit a pop of 1M). The game is a complete time killer as you manage and grow your city from austere farmlands to sprawling megacities. The game has some bugs, I have had the game crash once before. All in all a great game. (B)

Still a great game, almost a decade later. My only hope is that with the new Sim City reboot, they bring back Streets of Sim City and Sim Copter, both of which integrated with older versions of Sim City. Ideally, they could be built straight into the game. Sim City 4 had vehicle missions but you it all took place in the isometric view.

Disregarding the trash pit soon to be released that EA has slapped the SimCity name onto, this most recent installation does everything right. Better graphics, more modding capabilities, and building a reigon from the ground up never gets old. Besides the wierd L.A highway driving skill of pedestrians, this game sums up for an overall fun experience.

Possibly the greatest CityBuilder in existence,bar past games in the series,SimCity4 puts you on the seat of a(or several) mayor(s) of a city! It's your job to take it from a dinky little town into a sprawling metropolis the size of New York(or better).

The game is a bit old,so a slight tweaking is required,but otherwise runs just fine.
I like this game, a definitive improvement over Simcity 3000, only issue I have is that I can't make bridges over water to other cities. I want my toxic sludge to spread everywhere damn it!

I hath grown towns and estates but on a whim.  Lo, and within thus same I hath snuffed it out.  Sim City 4, thou art but the canvas by which I raise then raze entire populations.  Endless lives brought up then brought low.  Behold my absolute power and tremble; thus speaks God. I mean Mayor.  I'm a mayor.

Sim City 4 is great, but it still runs like garbage, even on modern hardware.  It ran like garbage back then, and it still does now, just in different ways, I guess.  Will randomly crash my video card driver, which is weird.  But it's great.  Do you like Sim City?  Then get this game.

One of the best economic simulator, still. For the game which'd been released in 2003, a graphic is very good (by adding some phrases to the shortcut, you can run this game in fullhd resolution), I love it's gameplay - the game is very easy to play (unlike Global Political Simulator 2, Crusader Knights 2, etc), in simcity I can build big city like New York or just a small village. I can use non-pollution solar or wind typed energy sources or forget about ecology and make money :) Again - graphic still is okay so I can play it on my 40 full hd screen without any trouble. Works on win7 x64bit. By the way, loadtime on the new machines (like core2duo or core i3) is pretty short. It loads like in 10 seconds for all!
Probably the best Sim City game once you get a few mods like the Network Addon Mod. It's too bad Sim City 2013 didn't live up to the ten year wait.
No matter how old or simplistic this game is i always find myself sitting down to play it for hours and hours.  And i think i am still learning to stop my city going bankrupt..:)

Great building simulation game. Played it before and it is a fabulous game. It's addicting. I love building my own city. You have all the tools you need to change the terrain or leave it flat, like me, and build a city your name. It's fun. I just hope there was infinite money or free mode so I can build without worrying about taxes, etc. Don't get me wrong, it's cool to manage the city but I want to play it my way too. :D 

Awesome game, get it! 9/10.

Do I really need to reccomend this to anyone?  It's SimCity.  Unlike the newer titles, this one is pretty much what you'd want from a SimCity game, though it has it's rough edges.  If you get it, be sure to look around online for some traffic mods- the game isn't terribly good at figuring out road designs all the time, so the traffic AI needs a little help.

SimCity 4 still remains today as one of the most definitive examples  of the city simulating genre. Even with the reboot of the SimCity franchise, SC4 still holds up as a classic of its predecessors before it. However, if Simcity's 2000 & 3000 were available, I'd highly recommend those but SC4 is still as good as it gets.

Before you play this game there are a few things that you need that are not in the game guide.

- No job
- No family
- A shit bucket so you do not need to leave your desk
- Vasaline/Lard
- A small dog that does not know right from wrong

You will then have everything you need to commit to this game.

This game may seem childish or old, but SimCity is an excellent time-waster that flips a few switches in the old noggin. Everything is connected to everything else somehow, and once you get a few cities going, it's basically a sandbox. This is the best citybuilder in the modern era- definitely better than Societies.

Great game, but beware! When I bought this I got hooked and spent 40 hours building up a metropolis. I like how you can connect neighbouring cities and plan whole regions, which makes for a much more expansive style of play than previous games in the series.

The first sim city game I didn't enjoy. There was something to be said about the simplicity and simultaneous difficulty of the original games. This game takes it too far. The amount of shit you have to micromanage in this game is beyond comprehensible, and the tutorials don't cover NEARLY enough once you're building a decent size city.

Just look at the amount of hours I've put into this. That's just from when the game came out on steam. Probably the only game I've played more than World of Warcraft, SC4 is the best game out there. Completely unique in it's own right, as there has never been a proper sequel or successor. With a modding community that still remains strong after 8 years the game is still fresh and worth the buy. If you liked any of the previous SimCities or The Sims, you'll love this installment of the series.

This 10yr old game does not start on my modern technology... No joke. Screen goes black then back to desktop. Nothing else.

Edit: Got it working. Shouldn't have to mess with games to make them run. Come on Steam.

The best city building game there is. Once you get it going - worryingly addictive. Time gets sucked away. Absolutely brilliant at it's best, really satisfying with something longlasting to show for your efforts.
At it's worst it's frustrative, harsh and crazy. But if you get it right you'll be having fun for years making your perfect metropolis - literally - I've been playing this game for the best part of a decade!
A must for all eclectic gamers.

I've always enjoyed Simuluation games like this, just don't know why. Is it the thrill of creation? Is it the thrill of achieving greatness or even status? Will never know. What I do know is that I highly recommend this game for anyone that's got the same passion about building worlds or cities. SimCity 4 brings all the elements from previous SimCities (notably SimCity 3000) and makes an improvement to this alreayd jam packed simulator.

New graphics and a far more efficent sim engine behind this game, makes everything just that little more rewarding once you've broken even with your funding. Even today, I still keep coming back to this one game, simply because seeing that little village expand towards a bustling metropolis is just so much darn fun...

4 / 5

Still the most fun and easy to play of the city simulators. Plenty to keep you busy especially with the interacting neighbouring city system which can also be played with other online players for trading and co-operative development and complementing economies. A simple game with hidden depth when played with others.

*Gnome Seal of Approval*
It seems no one could top SimCity 4 when it comes to city management. Here you can spend hours building and evolving your city from a simple farm town to a huge metropolis.

With the addition of the Rush Hour Expansion, Simcity 4 became the greatest game in the series. It is shameless and inexcusable that EA continues to mock loyal Sim City fans by releasing games and expansion after expansion in 'The Sims' franchise while giving Simcity fans...NOTHING. Simcity Societies.....don't even go there with me. Give us a true sequel to Simcity 4!
The mods for this game are amazing! A necessary mod for Simcity 4 is the NAM (you can find it over at Simtropolis.com) which adds tons more transportation types and improves the games' pathfinding. Check out the BAT as well >> homes, skyscrapers, conds, landmarks, parks, etc that you can download and have appear when conditions are right.....or wrong ;-) in your city and region.

Still the best City Sim ever made, with a huge library of extra user-made content on simtropolis. Although the 2D grid-based system does feel old now compared to Cities XL 2011, it's less buggy and better working. And a lot more features.
Its a decent game, but it has too many bugs in it, including shutting itself down while you are playing......I just lost a city I was working on for 3 hours due to that.

Old Skool! When it comes to Sim City! Only let down is, With how fast technolgy is moving you only get a 1024/768 Resoution with this so only using a quater of your montior and gfx outdated which is natural, Still alot of fun. 3/5.

Fully having taken the reins from Sim City 2000 Sim City 4 is the quintessential city builder simulation game available today.  I have spent more hours playing this game than most games I have owned.  By far one of the best games of all time BUY THIS GAME!!

Given a second chance, and a bunch of patches a year and a half later, and this game is actually playable.

Can still be increidbly unstable on certain hardware, especially if you dont have up to date drivers.

Worth it if its on sale, since once you can actually play it it's better than citiesXL
